tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE social_media_post_scheduling (
    post_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_content TEXT,
    post_date TIMESTAMP,
    user_id INT,
    engagement_score DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE social_media_posts (
    post_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_content TEXT,
    user_id INT,
    post_date TIMESTAMP,
    engagement_score INT
);

CREATE TABLE user_engagement (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    followers_count INT,
    likes_count INT,
    comments_count INT,
    last_post_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE scheduled_posts (
    scheduling_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id INT,
    scheduled_date TIMESTAMP,
    scheduled_time TIME,
    status VARCHAR(10)
);

CREATE TABLE user_profiles (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
    follower_count INT,
    engagement_score FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE post_schedule (
    post_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    post_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
    post_content TEXT,
    engagement_level VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE post_engagement (
    engagement_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id INT NOT NULL,
    likes INT,
    shares INT,
    comments INT
)

CREATE TABLE engagement_patterns (
    pattern_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    pattern_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    peak_engagement_time TIME
)

CREATE TABLE engagements (
    engagement_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    post_id INT NOT NULL,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    engagement_type VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
    engagement_date DATE NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE schedules (
    schedule_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT NOT NULL,
    post_id INT NOT NULL,
    schedule_date DATE NOT NULL,
    schedule_time TIME NOT NULL
);
